snippet: The corner of Cortlandt and Greenwich, an intersection that was designed out of existence for the construction of the World Trade Center, is to open on Friday.
abstract: Corner of Cortlandt Way and Greenwich Street, intersection that was designed out of existence for construction of the World Trade Center, will open; it is first recreated street intersection in goal to reintegrate 16-acre site with rest of Lower Manhattan.
lead_paragraph: The corner of Cortlandt and Greenwich, an intersection that was designed out of existence for the construction of the World Trade Center, is to open on Friday.

headline.main: At World Trade Center Site, Rebuilding Recreates Intersection of Long Ago
headline.print_headline: Rebuilding Recreates Intersection of Long Ago
